Reviews.Title: “Clean but simple & a little old”
Reviews.Author: wrazoruu
Reviews.Content: The double mattresses were totally saggy...we even changed rooms & was still the same. Our 1st room had hot shower problems. Both rooms were facing the front street & wifi was only reachable from inside the closet well...the rest of the room was useless! Other room our friends stayed in was good signal though. Daily cleaning was decent.

Reviews.Title: “my best choice than a hostel”
Reviews.Author: mariadivina23
Reviews.Content: I know its a cheap hotel. its my 2nd time in SG, you can hardly find with its price. Before i went a hostel, much dirty, no privacy, etc. I choose here coz its nearer to Airport. Just a little walk, bus are around though it can be confusing at first, its in between Aljunied and Kallang MRT. So far i havent encountered roaches around, though air con has no control button, sometimes it become too cold, i turned it off. Theres hot and cold water, though its not spacious. Not good if you have kids and large things. Its enough for us since we got 1 suitcase. Well, the receptionist give us nice location, at the rear end. I havent heard any noise. if you try to communicate with the receptionist, i try to simply my english, coz sometimes they wouldnt understand. Theres many food stalls around, if you choose to eat there. At night, you can understand its a red light district. But they dont do harm, its safe in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Only book if you are on a budget!!”
Reviews.Author: piglet33
Reviews.Content: Firstly I feel quite bad writing a poor review but I really hope the hotel read them and improve the situation. My friend and I have travelled for the past year to many different countries staying a lot of times in hostels. We knew Singapore was expensive so opted to stay here at the amrise after looking at many places online and thought this looked ok. Our expectations were not high as other people have said it's in the red light district and rooms are rented by the hour but we had no issues with either of these. On arrival we got shown to our room.... It was tiny!!! 2 single beds and a small wardrobe and desk ... No where to put anything! It appeared like it hadn't been cleaned..... We opened the fridge and it was full of food going moldy!!! I informed reception who came up and cleaned it out but the fridge smelt awful!!! There was hair everywhere .... On the floor and on beds. We had a constant stream of small cockroaches and bugs..... This was sorted after the first day as we got a can of insect repellent and sprayed the whole room each morning and night!! And left the aircon running whilst we were our!! More bugs were there but thankfully usually dead! Our room was not cleaned for the 5 nights we were there but this maybe because we didn't leave the key at reception ..... We did get clean towels and water but had to ask for them. The aircon is controlled by the hotel... You have to ask them to change the temperature which is a pain. The bathroom was not good.... Old and moldy in places. And bugs all the time came up the plug holes and from cracks in the walls. The tv didn't have any English channels... But not really an issue. The hotel is between 2 MRT stations and has bus stops close by so easy to get around. There are lots of food stands in the area and street restaurants. Yes it is in the red light area but we felt really safe and had no problems walking around. The staff were all male..... But very helpful and nice! Just a shame the hotel doesn't do them justice! Please improve the cleanliness!!! Overall if you are on a tight budget then it's a decent option.... But check the room first..... Make sure it's clean!

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of chinese people”
Reviews.Author: Papino_Tereko
Reviews.Content: Very good ratio price and quality, the room is clean and every thing is at the proper place. the bathroom is efficient, the paint is ok everything work well. Goodlocation to go any there is the city from the MTR or the bus there is so much passing around. Good fruit area, dim sum open 24 hours indian and chinese restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: sparkyrob
Reviews.Content: We booked this place through hostelbookers as budget hotels are unfortunately hard to find in Singapore and most of them are in Geylang: the red light district. This place has rooms by the hour, so you know what to expect. We had a cramped room but with a comfortable bed and free bottled water and air-con (as well as a TV). Small cockroaches in the bathroom, tired furnishings, noisy corridor. The reason it's 3 stars and not less is because we knew what to expect and it was much nicer than the dire Fragrance hotels in the same area. It's fine for travellers on a budget who need one night. But if you're looking for a "nice" hotel, look elsewhere (and be prepared to pay more)

Reviews.Title: “Great for what it is.”
Reviews.Author: Danielle K
Reviews.Content: From the cheap backpacker's perspective, this hotel is great. It's about as cheap as you can get for a private room in Singapore AND it was clean, quiet, and in a good location. The bed was also very comfortable. Not much more to ask for. Yes, the rooms are small, but I've had much smaller (which were also dirtier and smellier too!). The Amrise was close to public transportation and had lots of food choices available nearby, including a small super market. You could pay the same amount for a much lovelier and ritzy place in Thailand or Cambodia, but those are much cheaper countries to travel in.

Reviews.Title: “europe level in asia”
Reviews.Author: kasian27
Reviews.Content: I spend 2 nights in this hotel in February. It's between two train stations which are not far away . Street is very busy with restaurants and shops near by, but you can sleep without any problems. I had single room , really small one but god equipment. You can prepare cafe or tea and bathroom is really clean as all room is. WiFi connection in room is god also. So much cheep restaurants around that you cant be hungry. Staff is correct , so, for that money it's good choice, I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: GracyT
Reviews.Content: Clean, Comfy Bed, and CHEAP by Singapore standards - but a TINY Room (the Smallest I've ever had), and NOT a place to stay for more than a night or two. I needed a hotel for just myself for one extra night at the end of a 15 day holiday in Singapore. My Fiancee was flying home the day before me, and as I was broke I needed somewhere MUCH CHEAPER than where we had been staying. All the staff I saw at Amrise were men, even the "Chamber Maids", which seemed strange since all the staff at our previous hotel, except for the Doorman, had been women. I got mixed up with my dates and arrived a day early, but they found me a room on the first floor - Good Job as I have a Bad Back and Amrise has No Lift, and no way could I have dragged my suitcases up more than one flight of stairs. Apart from an unpleasant Disinfectant + Perfume smell in Reception, I found the rest of the place was Clean and Fresh, including my room. This was my first ever "interior" room, with no window. After a long sleep on my second night I had no idea what time it was when I woke up, or even if it was Day or Night ! There was NO wardrobe and NO drawers for clothes. Clothes had to be kept in my suitcase, or hung on the back of the door using the five hooks and three hangers provided. Totally Inadequate (and very crowded too) if a couple were using the room. The bathroom was OK. I had a decent electric shower, washbasin, large mirror, towel rack and toilet. Everything worked and it was clean. Geylang is a poor, working class suburb of Singapore and Sims Avenue is a very busy road with lots of traffic. The smells from all the street cafes take a bit of getting used to, but I've always felt Safe there, even at night, and the ordinary Singaporians are friendly and helpful. There are lots of market stalls nearby where excellent fruit and veg can be bought very cheaply, and at night, even if you are "not buying", a wander through the Red Light District is quite Entertaining and Totally Safe. Singapore has the BEST Mass Rapid Transit System I've ever used. The trains are Clean, Fast and Frequent, Very Affordable and cover most of the island. Aljurnied MRT Station is only 5-10 minute walk away, and from there, for less than 2 dollars, you can be in the City Centre in 10 mins or the Airport in 20 mins.

Reviews.Title: “Wrong place to stay recommended by agoda”
Reviews.Author: casastyles
Reviews.Content: I went for a short trip to singapore and i had to book on a last minute a room. So i check on agoda and this place was nicely describe on the website with pictures and facilities. This was a nightmare. I wont recommend anyone tomstay there coz this is crap. The only good thing is the location. Near kalang skytrain station and 20 min from the airport. You pay only 2.60 sing dollar from the airport to the kalang station and then 10 min walk. Its in the chinese areas. U have a lot of chinese food court around, i found nice olace to eat Mie 10 minutes from the hotel for only 1 sing dollar. The room was a deluxe rated by agoda for 44 euros. They said hot water for the shower never had hot water, the television didnt work, and the only good thing is free wifi thats working well. I didnt sleep at all because the noise people in and out all night long and shouting in the corridor. I could stay some other places and i did choose this place based on agoda. Now i know that i cant rely on their comments and reviews. The bathroom was dirty that i didnt want to shower, hairs all around the bathroom. The bed was so old that u could feel the holes from previous guest, the pillows was to strong. Real nightmare

Reviews.Title: “Cheap rooms but clogged toilet!”
Reviews.Author: jwyh
Reviews.Content: We paid US$65 on agoda to stay in a deluxe room. The deluxe room is 3 x 3m and pretty much just fits the bed. Checkin was fine and the man was nice enough. Climbed 2 sets of stairs to arrive to our windowless room. There was hair all over the bed which I was not impressed with. The main issue was the clogged up toilet. It didn't help that the both of us were not feeling well. The walls are also very thin and there was construction noise starting from 7.00 am. We only picked this place because everything seemed to be sold out except for fragrance hotels and only needed it for 1 night. I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Small and muggy”
Reviews.Author: Tony247
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in was small and muggy. There were insects everywhere and the front desk wasn't very polite to say the least. We ended up staying here because the hotel we wanted was full and plus it was only an over night stay because of our flight. The bed was stiff and hard as well as the pillow. You might as well use a rock to rest your head on. I wouldn't stay here again nor will I recommended for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Baby cockroaches. Rude and aggressive manager.”
Reviews.Author: Scrawl
Reviews.Content: It's a cheap option and I didn't expect much. Check-in was grand. A really nice and friendly taller gentleman checked us in and we got a room with a window instead of the cheaper windowless room that we had booked. An upgrade! The rooms are tiny. That was fine. But our room had little baby cockroaches. I saw three of them over the course of two nights. Yuk. The manager was the rudest little runt I have ever come across. A nasty piece of work. Avoid this place.

Reviews.Title: “Good and efficient.”
Reviews.Author: Shangar96
Reviews.Content: Me and my family stayed here for 4 days in this hotel. We took the MRT straight from the airport and stopped at the Aljuinied station. Then it took about 10 minutes to the hotel. Based on the other reviews, Geylang is said to be an active red light district. But for the 4 days we stayed there, we didn't see much girls there, although I saw some disturbing scenes there. We didnt stay much in Geylang. It's completely safe to walk here around 1 am. The staff here are really friendly and helpful too. The room though, my parents took a normal room while my bro and I took the other one. The first thing I saw when I entered this room was an underwear laying around ! I was totally disgusted and complained to the staff. Otherwise the hotel was nice. The place is very noisy, especially when there's BPL games on weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Only for the budget traveller!”
Reviews.Author: nzbear
Reviews.Content: This is a "get what you pay for" kind of place. Unless you're on a really tight budget, go find somewhere nicer. About 10 minutes walk from Kallang MRT this place is surrounded by popular eating places - and apparently an active red-light area! No lift in the hotel. Staff pleasant and helpful. No computers but wifi available. I had chosen a "deluxe room" (ha ha). Mine was on the front of the hotel which is right on a very busy road. When I asked to move back I was told the deluxe rooms are all at the front - noisy and catching all the light from neon signs outside. The rooms are basic with an attached bathroom. Small TV with patchy reception and limited range of channels. Fridge included. Aircon adequate. For one night between flights this is bearable but there's much better on offer in singapore - although nothing decent at this kind of price!!

Reviews.Title: “filty and warm room”
Reviews.Author: eliza2663
Reviews.Content: The first day I was given the room on the third floor. The room was good but I but I ask to be transferred to 2nd floor coz I have hard time going up. I was given another room the nest day which is room 217. I as in a hurry and did not check the room before I transfer and to my horror room 217 was filthy the ceiling has like a hole. The airconditioner is not working it was much colder in the reception area.the aircon is also filthy so is the ceiling of the bathroom. So i requested for another room when I get back the hotel but they told me that there is no available room and it was very late already so I have no choice but to sleep in a warm and filthy room. The next day i cmplained and they informed me that ehy are going to check and clean. I went back to the hotel again very late and to my horror its still the same the aircon is working but the air that is coming out is not cold so I have to sleep on a warm room. And in the morning when I wake up I check that still the aircon is dirty also. And there is no fridge

Reviews.Title: “Clean and efficient”
Reviews.Author: Michael H
Reviews.Content: I had a good stay at this hotel. Check in was quick and easy. My room was small, but very clean - except for the sink for some reason which must have just been missed. The staff was friendly and helpful. It was about a 10 minute walk from the MRT, but it was just a few stops from the city center. The neighborhood had lots of great restaurants and fruit stands. It is apparently the Red Light District, but I can't imagine you would know that if somebody didn't tell you. Wi-fi was okay, but a little patchy in my room at the back. In all, I would say this was a nice hotel at a very good price, in a reasonable location. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: deanorbs
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Amrise for a week. I was looking for an affordable place to stay since I was going stay for a bit more than the typical 3d4n and I chanced upon this quaint little hotel. It's a 3 storey hotel within the Geylang area. Now, most people know what Geylang is famous for, but during my stay here, I have not met one working lady. Most of them stay over at the area around Geylang Road. This hotel, while being close to it is along Sims Avenue and has hardware shops and all-night Chinese eateries around it. Oh, and the durian sellers at the front. I have no complains about the place since I was expecting less for the price I had paid. I mean, Singapore is expensive, but compared to similarly priced hotels in Hongkong, this one is a steal. I checked into a Deluxe room, about 20$ more than the standard, but I had windows and a Large enough room and a queen-sized bed. The noise from the street was tolerable and wifi is free! The bed sheets are changed daily by friendly staff, 2 bottles of purified water and 2 packets of instant coffee are yours daily for free. The room was newly refurbished with new tiles, wall papers, furnishings its got a small ref where I can keep food and beverage in. The bathroom has enough space to move around. It's a few minutes walk to 2 MRT stations and bus stops, and the guys at the desk will give you directions when you ask. Overall, my stay was pleasant. I would recommend this hotel to my friends, depending on the purpose of their travel.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable hotel”
Reviews.Author: anythinggoes-etc
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in Amrise last July. Our stay was very good. It is a basic hotel but we have a good sleep since it is quiet, even if it is near red light district of SG. By the way, red light district here is unnoticeable, you will not even know it is a red light district, it seems peaceful and safe. The room we stayed (double standard) has a nice bed, and good air condition. It has its own bathroom with hot and cold. There is lcd tv and complimentary bottled water and coffee. Our room was in the second floor and the hotel has no elevator but that is okay, it is understandable, since it is a three-storey hotel. In terms of location, it is near Kallang MRT station--only walking distance, and near bus stops. We got the room for S$55 through Agoda. It's one of the most affordable hotels in SG. You can see some photos and places we visited during our trip in Singapore here: http://anythinggoes-etc.blogspot.com/2011/08/singapore-was-my-destination-last-july.html

Reviews.Title: “A great find!”
Reviews.Author: bryantpark88
Reviews.Content: Chilled out in SG for a few days thanks to a cheap fare I got months back. Since my trip was more out of a whim, I decided to look for a cheap place to stay. I booked a room at Amrise based on the price and reviews on Agoda. I wasn't really expecting much considering the cheap price I paid but I can say that I got more than what I expected. With my hotel voucher on hand, check in took less than 1 minute after handing out my passport to be photocopied. Our room was on the 3rd flr and there was no lift but it's a small building anyway. Our room was pretty small and basic but I expected it since it was indicated when I booked. However, it was fixed up just like a hotel. The room was immaculately clean and the sheets smelled fresh. The bathroom was larger than what I expected, about double the size of what you'd find in HK hostels and was likewise clean. About the only comment I can make was the lack of a shower curtain which would help a lot to keep the bathroom floor dry. Location was ok, located between Aljunied and Kallang EW MRT stations. It's a bit of a hike and can be quite uncomfortable in the heat and humidity but quite manageable. It was my first time to stay in the Geylang area and again, it wasn't as bad as I've read. It does get busy at night but you can hardly notice it once you're in the room. There are likewise countless dining options as soon as you get out of the hotel. For the price I paid, I would rather think of Amrise as a nice hostel rather than a small hotel. Overall, I had a very pleasant stay at Amrise with special thanks to the front desk personnel, Thomas and Roger, for being friendly and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what we were looking for”
Reviews.Author: Voilareally
Reviews.Content: Great location - about a 7 minute walk to the nearest MRT station. Staff were very friendly and helpful. We had free WiFi and the rooms were cleaned everyday. Drawbacks - room was very small, also the A/C is set by reception so you have no control over how warm/ cold the room is.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant service, cheap, well located.. just great.”
Reviews.Author: hellooholly
Reviews.Content: this was a brilliant choice for us! *staff were incredibly helpful and lovely, so personable, really going out of their way to meet all our requests, including: - lending us their personal iphone charger overnight (and letting us know what time the staff member who owned one would be starting his shift) - lending us a bottle opener - keeping our luggage all day for a late flight, and again letting us charge our laptop in their staff room even though we'd already checked out. one of the the staff who we'd struck up conversation with a few times even gave us a gift for my young son when we left! *price was brilliant, half the price of anywhere else in singapore. *the room was: - small, yes, but to be expected, and perfectly adequate for a couple and small child (on his own sleeping inflatable mat). - clean room and toilet, instant hot water, good aircon (no remote). - safe, with access to rooms only via the frontdesk, and hallway cameras everywhere. *location: lots of great 24 hr bars and casual food outlets downstairs, with many of the best places in singapore (look it up). some faves include: - the 24hr yumcha/dimsum restaurant, not immediately apparent from the street, but a dizzying array of amazing food (inc top vegetarian options) and quite well known. - a beancurd (tau hwa) (silken in syrup, warm) shop that is simply the best. also has great curry puffs. also, 24hr internet cafes and convenience stores (with alcohol) right nearby. also a money changers around the corner. the working girls are no issue, they keep to themselves and their potential clientele. just be clear about what you want (or don't want) when you go for a massage. downsides are: - very difficult to get and keep internet connection on our mobile device. - if street windows are open, very loud traffic (no noise from other rooms though). - strange mattress slopes toward the middle very steeply, like sleeping on a hill (albeit a very comfy and good quality mattress-hill). - 10 mins walk from the mrt, a bit annoying with a pram so many times a day (pathways have big steps every 20m, a real trek). for the price, this is an unbeatable choice.

Reviews.Title: “Average!”
Reviews.Author: Kiwicossie
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at this hotel. Chose it because of price and location near an MRT and if those weren't true then this place would suck! You stay on Durian St so it always smells, there's an hourly rate advertised at the front desk and the room was literally enough for a bed two bags and not much else (let alone windows). All-in-all nothing was really wrong with the place just decidely average. Unlikely I'd return. Perhaps try getting twin room - less chance someone has spent the previous hour in it haha. I'd recommend for people on a budget but try the YMCA first because the location is better and really the private bathroom isn't worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: neckiii
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean and spacious. The previous hotel we stayed in Singapore was double the money and heaps smaller. It appears to have been newly renovated. It is on a busy street close to lots of Asian food options (some 24h). You will need ear plugs if you are a light sleeper but for the price this place was perfect. The staff was friendly and helpful, especially the young girl who works during the day. Initially we were concerned with the location being in the red light district but we did not feel scared at all. We even walked around the area at 1am with no problem. The room does have hourly rates and some people may be concerned that prostitutes would rent the rooms. We however did not see any one who looked problematic. To be safe you can always ask for the twin bed as we did and having checked the mattresses before checking in we noticed that they were brand new. I would recommend this hotel to all budget travellors.

Reviews.Title: “overated”
Reviews.Author: iwanttotravelforfree
Reviews.Content: good: close to bus stop and aljunied stn a lot of restos nearby authentic chinese few steps when you go to the right cold and quiet ac free internet, though id did not work for us, but my friend in another room was able to use it, they were beside the stairway bad: hair on our blanket when we arrive room too small, if you have a big luggage, u wont be able to move no cable coffee, toiletries, bottled water must be asked before they bring it to you not hospitable, keeps on hanging up when i was asking for toothpaste no elevator

HotelInfo.Name: Amrise Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 112 Sims Ave | Geylang, Singapore 387436, Singapore
